Totally agree. This was even added to Console Edition in TU57, meaning there will be another reason to play Legacy Console Edition instead of bedrock.

As a Java player, I don't see why we have to remove stuff for the sake of parity? I'd love to have Bedrock's old campfire mechanics and string recipe, specifically - shouldn't parity weigh more on the side of adding things instead of taking them?

I... kind of get the horse boats, and in the case of the shattered savannas I don't really think it matters that much for parity? Textural changes aren't important to have distinct - the fact that Java's grass color is different won't invalidate any tutorials or anything. For the campfires and cobwebs, however, I think we should just... add these to Java.

Yes, please bring this back. I used this the day before the update and went to use it again today and found it was removed. I'm not sure what the purpose of removing it is, but doing so made it much more difficult to get string, and also makes the cobwebs less useful. Please bring this back so that we can continue to get string as we normally could.

Im also dissappointed in this removal. I dont play java and really dont care what it looks like or the gameplay. But removing useful features from your game is annoying. Cobwebs now serve no purpose whatsover to harvest anymore. Please return this recipe..... now

Peaceful player also really disappointed this has been removed. If it's an issue of originally being overpowered, then why not make it so you need a couple of web to craft string.

Dear mojang, how about listening to player feedback how you promised??? Everybody hates that you removed this recipe and yet you do nothing, thank you for keeping your promise and the respect you show towards the player base's feedback.

As a peaceful player, the only way to get string is to find it in a chest or fish for it, but you need a fishing rod, which uses string, to get it. Cobwebs converting into 9 string enabled me to have string for scaffolding and building as well as crafting a loom. This is just another blow to people who play on peaceful and are restricted from obtaining items because of that. I'm really disappointed in this change.

Yea it makes the locator map useless
There is a reason it was called a locator map and requires a compass to make it. Dumb change period. Basically just screwed hundred of hours of time people invested in maps.

I been playing on my son's realm since 2012 on xBox.  I have HUNDREDS of portals and have Nether railways that take 15 minutes or more to travel end-to-end.  Sometimes when he joined the realm I would not know where he was.  I could always find the direction to go where he was on a locator map.  Now since what I am assuming to be a parity change from Java the camera icon changes off map to a blob and goes away completely if traveled far enough from the map.  I am not a Java hater.  I bought Minecraft Java for PC,  Mac, and Linux.  I also bought Bedrock for PC, Switch and xBox.  On Java I can always toggle the debug screen to see my co-ordinates.  Yes I know you can turn them on in Berock, but it is not my realm and my son says you don't have them in real life so he won't turn them on in his realm.  This one change has made Minecraft unplayable for me.  Please fix this.  I you won't make this like it was due to 'parity'. then give me a debug screen for Bedrock so I am not blind with the SEVEN shulker boxes full of locator maps I carry around in an ender chest to navigate this realm as they are all now rendered useless by this change.  I have spent the last weeks trying to find my way back to a place I was where I was mining .  Thank you.
Guys this is a tragic change. Here the parity should have IMPROVED JAVA and not screwed up bedrock!!!

I've played Minecraft on and off, since way before even the magicians were introduced.

I've had worlds, lost worlds, lost worlds to other people hosting and not being able to get the seed / world.

I've recently gotten through my minecraft burnout, and came back and founded a village.

The game's really not hard if you know what you're doing.

I see Coal / Iron is harder to get, while diamonds are way easier to get. cool. I need iron / coal so I look for it, leave the locator map, because apparently this is a thing now?

Luckily, have good sense of direction. traveled back 5000+ blocks to get back to my village.

Without the use of coordinates, how am I supposed to find my way back now? Why was this change even invoked? What is the use of a locator map, if the locator doesnt work propperly?

I think ima go back to taking a break lol, im not missing out on much apparently.

Hi Mojang, I'm here to report a little discomfort regarding the new touch controls. I loved the new touch controls, the problem is the way they are separated and aligned with cell phones. On my smartphone the buttons are gigantic at 100%, but when I reduce the size the jump and crouch buttons go to the center of the screen, making it complicated to use. I wanted to ask you to solve this problem, I really wanted to use the new controls, but it's very difficult.
